DataElement.preferredName: Confirmation Laboratory Procedure To Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Reporting Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The month, day and year that the confirmed laboratory procedure was reported to the CDC.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Confirmation Laboratory Procedure To Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Reporting
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Having been established or verified._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._An agency of the US Public Health Service that serves as the national focus for developing and applying disease prevention and control, environmental health and health promotion and health education activities designed to improve the health of the people of the United States. The CDC is responsible for controlling the induction and spread of infectious diseases, and provides consultation and assistance to other nations and international agencies to assist in improving their disease prevention and control, environmental health, and health promotion activities._The act of providing a short account.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having been established or verified.:Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Concepts.definition: Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.

Concepts.longName: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
Concepts.definition: An agency of the US Public Health Service that serves as the national focus for developing and applying disease prevention and control, environmental health and health promotion and health education activities designed to improve the health of the people of the United States. The CDC is responsible for controlling the induction and spread of infectious diseases, and provides consultation and assistance to other nations and international agencies to assist in improving their disease prevention and control, environmental health, and health promotion activities.
The act of providing a short account.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
